com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface DnsResolverService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
public interface DnsResolverService
extends Service

DNS Resolver Service. Handles host and ip address resolution for a single host or multiple hosts in parallel with both blocking and callback invoked results

Since:
5.5.5.5

Method Detail

getHostByAddress

void getHostByAddress(byte[] addr,
                      DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                      int priority,
                      long timeout,
                      boolean canonical)
Resolves a raw IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
IPv4 address byte array must be 4 bytes long and IPv6 byte array must be 16 bytes long

Parameters:
addr - the raw IP address in network byte order
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostByAddress

DnsResolvedHost getHostByAddress(byte[] addr,
                                 int priority,
                                 long timeout,
                                 boolean canonical)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Resolves a raw IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
IPv4 address byte array must be 4 bytes long and IPv6 byte array must be 16 bytes long
Unlike getHostByAddress(byte[], DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method does block.

Parameters:
addr - the raw IP address in network byte order
priority - notifies caller of response when ready
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
DnsResolvedHost instance from the resolution query or null if host could not be resolved
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.

getHostByAddress

void getHostByAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                      DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                      int priority,
                      long timeout,
                      boolean canonical)
Resolves a raw IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
Unlike InetAddress.getByAddress(byte[]), this method performs reverse DNS lookup.
IPv4 address byte array must be 4 bytes long and IPv6 byte array must be 16 bytes long

Parameters:
addr - the IP address string in textual presentation
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostByAddress

DnsResolvedHost getHostByAddress(java.lang.String addr,
                                 int priority,
                                 long timeout,
                                 boolean canonical)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Returns an InetAddress object given the raw IP address. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
IPv4 address byte array must be 4 bytes long and IPv6 byte array must be 16 bytes long
Unlike getHostByAddress(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method does block.

Parameters:
addr - the IP address string in textual presentation
priority - notifies caller of response when ready
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
DnsResolvedHost instance from the resolution query or null if host could not be resolved
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.

getHostByName

void getHostByName(java.lang.String name,
                   DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                   int priority,
                   long timeout,
                   boolean canonical)
Given the name of a host, returns an array of its IP addresses, based on the configured name service on the system.
The host name can either be a machine name, such as "java.sun.com", or a textual representation of its IP address. If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
For host specified in literal IPv6 address, either the form defined in RFC 2732 or the literal IPv6 address format defined in RFC 2373 is accepted.

Parameters:
name - the name of the host (cannot be null)
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostByName

java.util.List<DnsResolvedHost> getHostByName(java.lang.String name,
                                              int priority,
                                              long timeout,
                                              boolean canonical)
                                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Given the name of a host, returns an array of its IP addresses, based on the configured name service on the system.
The host name can either be a machine name, such as "java.sun.com", or a textual representation of its IP address. If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
For host specified in literal IPv6 address, either the form defined in RFC 2732 or the literal IPv6 address format defined in RFC 2373 is accepted.
Unlike getHostByName(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method blocks.

Parameters:
name - the name of the host (cannot be null)
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
list of DnsResolvedHost instances from the resolution query
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.

getHostsByAddress

void getHostsByAddress(byte[][] addrs,
                       DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                       int priority,
                       long timeout,
                       boolean canonical)
Resolves the raw IP addresses. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
This method is similar to calling getHostByAddress(byte[], DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean) for each address, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.

Parameters:
addrs - the array of the raw IP addresses in network byte order
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostsByAddress

java.util.List<DnsResolvedHost> getHostsByAddress(byte[][] addrs,
                                                  int priority,
                                                  long timeout,
                                                  boolean canonical)
                                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Resolves the raw IP addresses. The argument is in network byte order: the highest order byte of the address is in getAddress()[0].
This method is similar to calling getHostByAddress(byte[], int, long, boolean) for each address, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.
Unlike getHostsByAddress(byte[][], DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method blocks.

Parameters:
addrs - the array of the raw IP addresses in network byte order
priority - notifies caller of response when ready
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
list of DnsResolvedHost instances from the resolution query
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.

getHostsByAddress

void getHostsByAddress(java.lang.String[] addrs,
                       DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                       int priority,
                       long timeout,
                       boolean canonical)
Returns an array of InetAddress objects given the raw IP addresses. The argument is the array of the IP address strings in textual presentation.
This method is similar to calling getHostByAddress(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean) for each address, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.

Parameters:
addrs - the array of the IP address strings in textual presentation
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostsByAddress

java.util.List<DnsResolvedHost> getHostsByAddress(java.lang.String[] addrs,
                                                  int priority,
                                                  long timeout,
                                                  boolean canonical)
                                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Returns an array of InetAddress objects given the raw IP addresses. The argument is the array of the IP address strings in textual presentation.
This method is similar to calling getHostByAddress(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean) for each address, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.
Unlike getHostsByAddress(String[], DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method does block

Parameters:
addrs - the array of the IP address strings in textual presentation
priority - notifies caller of response when ready
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
list of DnsResolvedHost instances from the resolution query
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.

getHostsByName

void getHostsByName(java.lang.String[] names,
                    DnsQueryResultsCallback callback,
                    int priority,
                    long timeout,
                    boolean canonical)
Given the array of a host names, returns a resolved list of hosts, based on the configured name service on the system.
This method is similar to calling getHostByName(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean) for each host name, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.
Each host name can either be a machine name, such as "java.sun.com", or a textual representation of its IP address. If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
For host specified in literal IPv6 address, either the form defined in RFC 2732 or the literal IPv6 address format defined in RFC 2373 is accepted.

Parameters:
names - the array of host names of the host (cannot be null or empty)
callback - notifies caller of response when ready
priority - sets the execution priority for the resolution. negative values have a higher priority, zero is equal priority
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name

getHostsByName

java.util.List<DnsResolvedHost> getHostsByName(java.lang.String[] names,
                                               int priority,
                                               long timeout,
                                               boolean canonical)
                                               throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Given the array of a host names, returns a resolved list of hosts, based on the configured name service on the system.
This method is similar to calling getHostByName(String, DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean) for each host name, but it can resolve multiple names simultaneously.
Each host name can either be a machine name, such as "java.sun.com", or a textual representation of its IP address. If a literal IP address is supplied, only the validity of the address format is checked.
For host specified in literal IPv6 address, either the form defined in RFC 2732 or the literal IPv6 address format defined in RFC 2373 is accepted.
Unlike getHostsByName(String[], DnsQueryResultsCallback, int, long, boolean), this method does block.

Parameters:
names - the array of host names of the host (cannot be null or empty)
priority - notifies caller of response when ready
timeout - max duration in milliseconds to wait for a response. Set to 0 to wait forever
canonical - true if result should include canonical host name
Returns:
list of DnsResolvedHost instances from the resolution query
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - if the resolving thread is interrupted.
